title: Improve error handling.
message:
Improve error handling.

We maintain a stack of errors in the global state. Each new error
is pushed onto this stack and marked as active. When a UI element
handles an error, it marks the error as handled through an action.
A result of this design is that all errors that have ever occured
are retained in state (but marked as inactive). We likely want to
add a bound to this stack so that accumulated errors don't slow
down the app.

title: Refactor ApiClient to unwrap results and throw errors.
message:
Refactor ApiClient to unwrap results and throw errors.

The previous behavior required the caller of ApiClient to check
both the `result` key in the returned object for the string
`success`, and to catch errors in a `catch` block. This change cleans
up the code by allowing the consumer of ApiClient to only handle thrown
errors. In addition, the consumer receives an unwrapped result
(such as api_key for a fetchApiKey call) instead of a wrapped object.
